TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HttpCachePolicyElement extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Represents the default HTTP cache policy for network resources. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class corresponds to the [\<defaultHttpCachePolicy\> Element (Network Settings)](../Topic/%3CdefaultHttpCachePolicy%3E%20Element%20\(Network%20Settings\).md) configuration element.
This class is used to specify the HTTP caching configuration that applies to network resources obtained by using the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebClient> classes.
This class provides programmatic access to information that can be stored in configuration files.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor adds the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement.MaximumAge%2A>, <xref:System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement.MaximumStale%2A>, <xref:System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement.MinimumFresh%2A>, and <xref:System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement.PolicyLevel%2A> properties to the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void DeserializeElement (System.Xml.XmlReader reader, bool serializeCollectionKey);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void DeserializeElement(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader, bool serializeCollectionKey) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum age permitted for a resource returned from the cache.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.TimeSpan> value that specifies the maximum age for cached resources specified in the configuration file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the cached copy of the resource is older than the specified time value, the resource must be revalidated by comparing the cached resource to the resource on the server.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum staleness value permitted for a resource returned from the cache.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.TimeSpan> value that is set to the maximum staleness value specified in the configuration file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property specifies the amount of time after content expiration during which the cached copy of the resource is acceptable.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum freshness permitted for a resource returned from the cache.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.TimeSpan> value that specifies the minimum freshness specified in the configuration file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value specifies the amount of time before content expiration, during which the cached copy of the resource is acceptable.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets HTTP caching behavior for the local machine.
Docs.value: A value that specifies the cache behavior.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Applications typically use <xref:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel> as their cache policy level. The <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A> property, if not `null`, determines the cache policy in effect for a request.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Reset(class System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement parentElement) cil managed
